titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1243: Liber mayor Prisciani de ordinatione partium orationis

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Books 17 and 18 of Priscian's Institutiones grammaticae, also known as De constructione, a guide to syntax. The Institutiones are a systematic examination and explanation of Latin grammar and were a staple of the medieval study of Latin. The text contains extensive interlinear and marginal annotations in Latin in a secretary script. Text at the end of the manuscript (f. 53v), seemingly not by Priscian, discusses Adonic meter.

msItem.title: Liber mayor Prisciani de ordinatione partium orationis

supportDesc.extent: 53 leaves : 250 x 195 (129 x 97) mm. bound to 262 x 195 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, i (modern paper) + 53 + i (modern paper); i-liii; contemporary foliation in Roman numerals in ink, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 31 lines; frame-ruled in lead, with main text written on alternate lines in text block and annotations, when present, written on every line in margins (for example, f. 51v).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic script, with annotations in a secretary script.

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials of 2-5 lines in blue and red ink; paragraph markers alternating in red or blue ink; chapter headings in margins in red ink; sketches in ink of a man (f. 14r), tree (f. 22r), and stag (f. 24r); manicules, some with decorated cuffs (f. 20v, 22v, 24r, 24v, 26v, 31r, 37r).
Penwork initial and heading, Initial I, f. 36r

origin.p: Probably written in Paris, late 13th century (Zacour-Hirsch).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by the monastery of Santa Maria de Carreto, 15th century (f. 53v).
Sold at auction at Hoepli, 21 May 1931, lot 75.

keywords.term: Latin language--Metrics and rhythmics--Early works to 1800
Latin language--Study and teaching--Early works to 1800
